meanings.definition: The act of making something longer or stretching it out.
meanings.sent1: The elongation of the rubber band was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting showed an interesting elongation of the subject's face.
meanings.sent3: The elongation of the spaghetti was so extreme that it reached the ceiling!
meanings.sent4: The elongation of time during the boring lecture made it feel like an eternity.
meanings.sent5: The elongation of the shadows as the sun set created a beautiful scene.

meanings.definition: The state of being elongated or stretched out.
meanings.sent1: The cat's elongation on the windowsill showed its comfort.
meanings.sent2: The elongation of the bridge made it look elegant and graceful.
meanings.sent3: The elongation of the giraffe's neck made it the tallest animal in the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The elongation of the river as it wound through the valley was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The elongation of the shadows at noon indicated the time for a siesta.
